benchmark_details.name: GUIDING Q
benchmark_details.overview: GUIDING Q is a dataset of 10,577 guiding questions extracted from research articles and textbooks to study their roles and effects on human reading comprehension.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze the use, distribution, and roles of guiding questions in academic writing, and to explore automated question generation techniques.

data.source: Extracted from textbooks and scientific articles, particularly from OpenStax, arXiv, and PubMed datasets.
data.annotation: Questions were extracted and annotated using both human and large language model (LLM) methods.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the generated questions' alignment with expert-generated questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better quality and relevance of generated questions.
methodology.validation: The dataset and models were validated through human studies and comparisons with existing datasets.

harm: Creating unequal social relationships through question framing.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants consented to the human studies conducted.
